page.title: 14Ashton Hayes C.P. School 1
page.content: There has been a school in Ashton since the 1850's.The present school building was built in 1968.It has three permanent classrooms and one mobile.The school stands in a rural setting of approximately three acres. In 1985 78 local children from 4-11 years attend the school.All pupils wear a school uniform which is grey with a maroon and blue tie.The girls wear red or blue gingham dresses in the summer.The curriculum includes Mathematics,Science,English,Music,R.E. Art and Craft,P.E.and Games.Other activities include swimming,gymnastics athletics,dancing,drama,playing musical instruments,chess,bookquizzes, field trips and rural studies.Each year the whole school combines together to produce a play or a musical.This is performed in the W.I. Hall for parents and friends.
